Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora, rising to moderate turn. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 210 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes (2015) 142.)
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 101a, 3. Name Xenophantos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0189.07.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0675)
